intro: Werneria acerosifolia, commonly known as the hard-leaved werneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rigid, almost leathery texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a pale yellow to greenish hue. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
